alert.note: Alert for Wayne (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued January 09 at 4:33PM EST until January 09 at 5:00PM EST by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 500 PM EST FOR NORTHEASTERN WAYNE COUNTY... At 432 PM EST, a severe thunderstorm was located over Fremont, or 11 miles north of Goldsboro, moving northeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Fremont, Pikeville, and Eureka. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 900 PM EST for central North Carolina. Straight line winds can blow down trees, power lines, and damage mobile homes and other buildings. Seek shelter in a sturdy structure until the storm has passed. Stay away from windows as flying debris generated by damaging winds can be deadly.
